image.altText: Three people standing in a row wearing green shirts that read "Really social social club" on the back.

props.synopsis: Lily Grimley was grabbed by the throat during an altercation at a social netball game a few years ago, forcing her out of the competition that she joined purely for social reasons — and it's not uncommon.

title.children: 'Tried to grab at my throat': Competitiveness in social sport pushing players out

image.altText: apartment block

props.synopsis: Compared with other major cities, Canberra's rental market was "quite flat" over the past year, with rents increasing by only $20 a week. That might be good news for renters.

title.children: Increased supply improving conditions for Canberra renters

image.altText: a mum with long brown hair and glasses kisses a six month old baby

props.synopsis: Many new mums turn to social media for the support of a community. But a group of Canberra mums have recently found out their local group, wasn't as local as they thought.

title.children: New mums turned to a Facebook group for support, but things weren't as they thought

image.altText: police and a police car at a rural property

props.synopsis: Police say no one was injured when a 20-year-old man allegedly shot at four men known to him.

title.children: Man charged after alleged attempted shooting in Canberra

image.altText: a man sits in the drivers seat of a car

props.synopsis: Some chargers along the Hume Highway have reportedly been down for months, meaning EV drivers are forced to plan ahead or take long detours. One driver says it made his "range anxiety" worse than usual this year.

title.children: 'Range anxiety' worse than usual for EV owners with chargers down and queues

image.altText: a school with a large sign reading st john paul ii college

props.synopsis: Parents of students attending Catholic and independent secondary schools in the ACT are facing school fee increases in 2025, including some by as much as 15 and 30 per cent.

title.children: Some ACT private schools facing fee increases as costs rise

image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Police say they also received a call from a university student who wanted their professor's contact details to request a deadline extension and a man who wanted a stray cat on his street to be arrested.

title.children: Calls to triple-0 included teen who lost internet, man who wanted stray cat arrested

image.altText: Back of a firefighter in yellow facing the ocean, standing in charred ruins

props.synopsis: Firefighters are working to make further progress against Los Angeles blazes that have killed at least 16 people as forecasters warn strong winds will return this week. Follow live.

title.children: LA residents fear more strong winds as threat level remains 'critical'

image.altText: A white, three-storey stucco home stands among the rubble of neighbouring properties

props.synopsis: Standing out like a beacon on the Malibu coastline is this three-storey mansion. Here's why its owner believes it's still intact.

title.children: Why this Malibu house is still standing when the coastline is ash

image.altText: A firefighter climbs a steep slope as flames burn around him

props.synopsis: The US president-elect slams Californian officials over their handling the fires in LA.

title.children: Trump blasts LA officials as area bigger than San Francisco razed

image.altText: Sun setting over the Indian Ocean

props.synopsis: Temperatures in 2024 officially exceeded the Paris Agreement target. Does that mean the world has failed?

title.children: The world's breached 1.5 degrees. But wasn't that our climate target?

image.altText: A woman speaking and pointing

props.synopsis: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is one of just a handful of world leaders to have been invited to Mar-a-Lago since his election victory last November — but whether she can be Europe's "Trump whisperer" is more complicated.

title.children: World leaders are vying for Trump's ear, and this one has pulled ahead

image.altText: Coco Guff celebrates winning a point.

props.synopsis: Third seed Coco Gauff kicks off her Australian Open against 2020 winner Sofia Kenin, while 12 local hopes hit the court, including the long-awaited return of Nick Kyrgios. Follow live.

title.children: Coco Gauff up against former champion to kick off day two featuring 12 Aussies

image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: The ASX has opened 1.2 per cent lower after US jobs data crunched Wall Street, while the Aussie dollar hit lows last seen in 2020. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Australian dollar near five-year low, ASX tanks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Aussie dollar at lowest point in almost five years
Wall St stumbles on jobs data, ASX set to follow

image.altText: Frank painting

props.synopsis: More people than ever before are picking up multiple jobs as the high cost of living pushes Australians to take on extra work, but the tax office warns people not to get caught out and know their obligations.

title.children: 'Constantly chasing my tail': More Aussies get second job

image.altText: Lightning over the hills with storms clouds and river and trees

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have been lashed by up to 100 millimetres of rain, with the Bureau of Meteorology predicting more wild weather could be on the way.

title.children: Queensland hit with heavy rains, with more wild weather on the way

image.altText: Ash Gardner plays a shot into the leg side in an ODI for Australia

props.synopsis: Ashleigh Gardner's hard-hitting approach might appear better suited to T20 cricket, but it is in the 50-over format where the all-rounder has returned to form.

title.children: Gardner finds form at the right time as Australia makes Ashes statement

image.altText: Man with long grey hair in a pony tail and a red work shirt sits in outdoor area of his home with his hands in his lap

props.synopsis: The average out-of-pocket cost for a GP visit has risen by 4.1 per cent nationally over the past year, with patients in Tasmania, the ACT and NSW paying the most.

title.children: Australians avoid the GP due to rising costs

image.altText: A woman in a pink puffer and a short blonde bob smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: The mother of an Australian man killed in the Los Angeles wildfires has recounted her desperate efforts to save her son and has urged people to remember him as a "courageous" and "beautiful soul".

title.children: 'Mum, just leave me': Mother fought to end to save Australian son in LA fire

image.altText: A red and white helicopter mid-flight droppng water over bright orange lines of flames on a hillside

props.synopsis: Since January 1, more than 101 wildfires have broken out across California. The state's fire department has deployed what is says is "the largest civil aerial firefighting fleet worldwide" to extinguish the flames.

title.children: Watch the 'world's largest' water-bombing fleet in action against the LA fires

image.altText: Close up of a mug with a magpie on its front and a tea bag hanging out

props.synopsis: Australia's hospitality industry is in need of training when it comes to serving up the world's most popular manufactured drink, tea experts say.

title.children: Tea drinkers face 'worst hospitality crime' in Aussie cafes

image.altText: Portrait of writer and comedian Sashi Perera wearing a long shirt dress that is pale purple, with a green skirt.

props.synopsis: Leaving my day job was the only way to circuit break my life back into balance. Six months later, life is very different.

title.children: My father died shortly after he retired. It changed my outlook on work

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: An illustration of a woman with a splash on her face

props.synopsis: A series of brutal acid attacks has raised alarm in Indonesia, with women's advocates warning that chemicals have often been used as the weapon of choice when a man wanted to "retaliate" after a relationship ended.

title.children: Men douse women in acid in spate of attacks in Indonesia

image.altText: A yacht with a man on board in the water

props.synopsis: A WA sailor who has not been seen since leaving Albany more than a fortnight ago had done the journey solo many times, according to a friend.

title.children: "One of the most experienced yachtsmen I know": Friends puzzled by sailor’s disappearance

image.altText: boxes of prescription drug xanax

props.synopsis: The recreational use of Xanax, a pharmaceutical drug used to treat anxiety and sleep disorders, is increasing among young people. Experts warn a growing black-market and lack of education around the drug is putting lives at risk.

title.children: Recreational use of Xanax grows among young Australians

image.altText: A baby bat; the image shows a baby bat wrapped in a small blanket as a carer tries to put a dummy in its mouth

props.synopsis: Thousands of lorikeets and flying foxes were treated for paralysis syndrome by RSPCA Queensland last year.

title.children: Paralysis syndrome strikes record number of lorikeets and flying foxes

image.altText: Visitors alight from the ferry onto Rockingham's Penguin Island

props.synopsis: Conservationists are calling for Penguin Island to be closed to visitors to allow the dwindling little penguin population to recover, but the state government insists the decline is due to climate change and not tourism.

title.children: Calls to close major WA tourism attraction to save 'hounded' penguins

image.altText: Malala Yousafzai speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Dozens of ministers and scholars from Muslim-majority countries attended the summit on girls' education in Pakistan.

title.children: Malala Yousafzai urges Muslim leaders to treat gender apartheid as a crime

image.altText: Large wind turbines stand in the ocean. No land is in sight, the wind turbines continue to the horizon.

props.synopsis: Any plans for turbines off the South Australian coast are gone, for now. But as the federal election looms, offshore wind will play a key role in Labor's renewable energy plan.

title.children: SA is a leader in renewable energy, but it said no to offshore wind

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell waves his bat towards the crowd while playing for the Stars

props.synopsis: After belting a typically incredible 90 from 52 balls for the Melbourne Stars, Glenn Maxwell concedes he would have made the same call as Australian selectors in opting for youth when picking the Sri Lanka tour squad.

title.children: Fresh from another BBL classic, Maxwell harbours no grudge for Test snub

image.altText: Runners participate in a parkrun.

props.synopsis: A study has found that inactivity in Western Sydney costs the region's economy $1.5 billion a year, with diverse communities, including Indigenous people and those from non-English speaking backgrounds, more at risk of inactivity.

title.children: 'Inactivity crisis' in Western Sydney costing region's economy $1.5 billion

image.altText: composite image featuring The Smith and Western Jury, Lane Pittman and Fanny Lumsden

props.synopsis: Country music is having a real moment, and these local acts will show Tamworth crowds that the Australian scene is as strong as any.

title.children: If you're heading to Tamworth, don't miss these Aussie artists

image.altText: A closed road outside the sign for the Fogg Dam Conservation Reserve

props.synopsis: A man has died and a woman is in hospital after a light aircraft crashed into the Fogg Dam recreational area south-east of Darwin.

title.children: Man dies in light plane crash south-east of Darwin

image.altText: A portrait photo of Gaye Martin smiling at her home

props.synopsis: In Melbourne's outer suburbs, social isolation can be an issue, but dedicated community members are doing their best to help residents stay connected through volunteer-run events like a weekly coffee club.

title.children: This Melbourne retiree is doing her best to tackle loneliness
